You can learn a new word in a foreign language by spending only 90 seconds for a month. \n 1) When you meet a new word, you should create card for it in the app. In context. It means , you are not writing down a "word â€“ translation", but a whole sentence in which a word has just met. And highlight the new word in bold. \n 2) Within seven days from the moment the card was created, you read sentence from this card aloud once or twice. Yes, yes, only once or twice! No need to try to remember it, but you should concentrate on it and understand what you are saying (and not repeating mechanically). It takes 10 seconds for two readings (checked). You\'ve been doing this for seven days. \n 3) After seven days of daily repetitions, you take a week break and a week later read card again aloud two or three times for 10 seconds. Yes, yes, only three times, but aloud, emotionally, clearly and concentrating on it! \n 4) And two weeks later, you read it aloud again three times within 10 seconds. \n Total: 90 seconds (70 + 10 + 10 ). With this strategy, the word and sentence are literally cemented in your memory. And the app will remind you when to repeat.
